alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:23PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cochise County through 215 PM MST... At 123 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Chiricahua National Monument, or 18 miles west of Rodeo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly remote areas of east central Cochise County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
